questions.question: What is the primary function of the ARP protocol?

options.A: Resolving domain names to IP addresses
options.B: Resolving IP addresses to MAC addresses
options.C: Assigning IP addresses to hosts

questions.question: In a TCP connection, the three-way handshake process involves:

options.A: SYN, ACK, FIN
options.B: SYN, SYN-ACK, ACK
options.C: ACK, FIN, RST

questions.question: What type of switch is used to connect devices within the same local area network (LAN)?

options.A: Hub
options.B: Router
options.C: Bridge

questions.question: Which of the following protocols is used to securely transfer files over a network?

options.A: FTP
options.B: HTTP
options.C: SFTP

questions.question: What is the function of the 'Subnet Mask' in an IP network?

options.A: To identify the default gateway
options.B: To define the range of valid IP addresses
options.C: To differentiate between the network and host portions of an IP address

questions.question: Which protocol is responsible for managing and monitoring network devices and their performance?

options.A: SMTP
options.B: SNMP
options.C: POP3

questions.question: What is the primary role of a content delivery network (CDN) in network infrastructure?

options.A: To provide secure remote access to internal resources.
options.B: To manage domain name registrations.
options.C: To optimize the delivery of web content to end-users.
options.D: To ensure encryption of data packets in transit.

questions.question: Which routing protocol is typically used within an Autonomous System (AS) to determine optimal routes between routers?

options.A: OSPF
options.B: BGP
options.C: RIP

questions.question: What is the main purpose of a Network Intrusion Detection System (NIDS)?

options.A: To block malicious IP addresses from accessing the network.
options.B: To encrypt data packets between network devices.
options.C: To detect and alert on suspicious network activities.

questions.question: Which protocol is responsible for routing email messages to their destinations across different mail servers?

options.A: SMTP
options.B: IMAP
options.C: POP3

questions.question: What is the purpose of a VLAN (Virtual Local Area Network) in networking?

options.A: To segment a physical network into multiple logical networks.
options.B: To provide a dedicated connection between two remote sites.
options.C: To prevent unauthorized access to the network.
options.D: To balance network traffic between multiple gateways.

questions.question: In the context of Quality of Service (QoS), what does 'bandwidth throttling' refer to?

options.A: Increasing the available network bandwidth to certain devices.
options.B: Dynamically adjusting the maximum transmission rate for specific traffic.
options.C: Redirecting network traffic to more efficient routes.
options.D: Disabling certain network services to prioritize others.

questions.question: What is the primary role of a Network Address Translation (NAT) firewall?

options.A: To filter incoming and outgoing traffic based on IP addresses.
options.B: To prevent data collisions in the network.
options.C: To translate private IP addresses to public IP addresses.
options.D: To route data packets between different subnets.

questions.question: What does the term 'congestion control' refer to in networking?

options.A: Ensuring that network devices are not physically damaged during heavy traffic.
options.B: Balancing traffic loads across multiple network segments.
options.C: Preventing unauthorized devices from accessing the network.
options.D: Managing and preventing network congestion by controlling data flow.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the Diffie-Hellman key exchange in network security?

options.A: To encrypt data packets during transmission.
options.B: To establish a secure connection between devices.
options.C: To detect and prevent unauthorized access.
options.D: To manage IP address assignments dynamically.

questions.question: Which protocol is used to synchronize the clocks of devices in a network to a common time reference?

options.A: NTP
options.B: DNS
options.C: DHCP

questions.question: What is the primary function of a router in a network infrastructure?

options.A: To forward data packets between devices within the same subnet.
options.B: To connect multiple networks and route data between them.
options.C: To manage IP address assignments for devices.
options.D: To filter incoming and outgoing data packets based on application.

questions.question: Which protocol is used to securely transfer files between a local and remote server using encryption?

options.A: FTP
options.B: SFTP
options.C: TFTP

questions.question: What is the purpose of a VPN tunnel in network security?

options.A: To encrypt data sent over an unsecured network.
options.B: To provide high-speed internet access to users.
options.C: To filter incoming and outgoing data packets.
options.D: To monitor network traffic for suspicious activities.

questions.question: Which protocol is used for dynamic IP address assignment to devices in a local network?

options.A: DNS
options.B: DHCP
options.C: ARP
